newsitem.title: UK: Pantheon buys two portfolios for 15mln stg.
newsitem.headline: Pantheon buys two portfolios for 15mln stg.

text.p: Equity investor specialist Pantheon International Participations (PIP) said on Wednesday that it has acquired two portfolios of private equity funds in the past five days for a total value of around 15 million stg.
One portfolio consists of interests in 12 European and American funds purchased from a UK-based institution, while the other comprises 27 funds in the US, Pantheon said in a statement.

"Both acquisitions continue PIP's secondary strategy which has generated strong performance for shareholders," Rhoddy Swire, Managing Director of Pantheon Group, said. "PIP continues to be well placed to access and analyse such opportunities."
At 1024 GMT Pantheon shares stood at 254 pence, up two.
Pantheon, which invests in private equity funds, said these acquisitions followed the buyings of secondary interests in July and August in a total value of 18.2 million stg.
